courseInfo.programName: Diploma in Information and Communication Technology

rationale: Electrical, Electronic and communication, Information and communication technology and allied engineering diploma holders are required to use and maintain various types of electronically controlled equipment. The fundamental principles of electronics are to be applied in most of the situations to arrive at the probable solutions which is faced in the world of work, therefore the knowledge of the functions of various basic electronic devices and components and practical skills acquired through the laboratory experiments will help them, when they work with electronic equipment and its sub-circuits. This course is designed to develop the skills to use the basics electronic devices and apply the knowledge to maintain the various types of electronic circuits.
competency: To maintain various electronic circuits and it's applications

courseOutcomes.description: Use electronic devices for various applications
Use different Thyristors for various applications
Use integrated circuits for various applications
Build Regulated Power Supply for Green Technology

practicalExercises.description: Build and test voltage divider bias type amplifier
To build relay driver using transistor as a switch
Obtain frequency response of single stage transistor amplifier
Obtain frequency response of two stage RC-coupled amplifier
Test the effect of voltage series negative feedback on amplifier
Build and test Hartley oscillator
Build and test Colpitt oscillator
Build and test Crystal oscillator
obtain the characteristics of SCR
obtain the characteristics of DIAC
obtain the characteristics of TRIAC
Control AC power using TRIAC
Control DC power using SCR
Use MOC 3041 /3083 Optocoupler and TRIAC for AC power control
Build and test inverting amplifier using Op-Amp IC-741
Build and test non-inverting amplifier using Op-Amp IC-741
Build and test summing amplifier using Op-Amp IC-741
Build and test integrator using IC-741 Op-Amp
Build and test differentiator using Op-Amp IC-741
Build and test comparator using Op-Amp IC-741
Build and test monostable multivibrator using IC 555
Build and test bistable multivibrator using IC 555
Build and test astable multivibrator using IC 555
Measure voltage at various test points of SMPS and obtain its load and line regulation
Build fixed voltage regulator using 78xx and 79xx and measure the load and line regulation
Build variable voltage regulator using LM317 and measure the dropout voltage for the given voltage regulator
Build and test one mini project using basic electronic components and general purpose PCB

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit

hardware: Dual variable DC power supply, 0- 30V, 2A, With Short circuit protection, separate display for voltage and current
Cathode Ray Oscilloscope, Dual Trace 20 MHz, 1MΩ Input Impedance
Function Generator 0-2 MHz with Sine, square and triangular output with variable frequency and amplitude
Digital Multimeter: 3 1/2 digit display, 1999 count digital multimeter measures: Vac, Vdc ( 600V max) , Adc, Aac (10 amp max) , Resistance ( 0 – 2 MΩ) , with diode and transistor tester

Electronic Workbench: Bread Board 840 -1000 contact points: Positive and Negative DC power rails on opposite sides of the board with , 0-30 V , 2 Amp Variable DC power supply, Function Generator 0-2MHz, CRO 0-30MHz , Digital Multimeter

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member
Practice environment friendly methods and processes

unitOutcomes.description: Explain biasing of amplifier and operating point
Describe the D.C. and A.C. Load Lines
Compare Biasing Methods
Explain Stability Factor with features
Describe Thermal Runaway and Thermal Stability
Select appropriate Heat Sink

topics.title: Biasing of Amplifier and Definition of Operating Point
The Load Lines: D.C. Load Line and A.C. Load Line
Stability Factor: Definition and features
Biasing Methods - fixed bias, collector to base bias and voltage divider bias (without analysis)
Thermal Runaway, Thermal Resistance & Thermal Stability
Heat Sink , types and applications of heat sinks

unitOutcomes.description: Define Amplifier Parameters
Explain Single Stage Amplifier
RC Coupling Techniques for cascading
Explain Frequency Response Two Stage RC Coupled Amplifier
Compare negative and positive feedback in amplifier
Describe types of negative feedback
Explain advantages and disadvantages of negative feedback in amplifiers in detail
Explain working of different type of oscillators
Explain working of transistor as switch

topics.title: Gain, Bandwidth and Gain Bandwidth product
Frequency Response of Single Stage Amplifier
RC Coupling Techniques for cascading
Frequency Response of Two Stage RC Coupled amplifier
Negative feedback and positive feedback (only types , and block diagram without analysis )
Voltage series negative feedback
List advantages and disadvantages of negative feedback on the parameter of amplifiers
The Barkhausen's criterion for oscillator
Hartley oscillators, Colpitt oscillator , Crystal oscillator
working of transistor as switch and relay driver

unitOutcomes.description: Describe constructional features and working of SCR, DIAC and TRIAC
Draw the characteristics of SCR, DIAC,TRIAC
Applications of SCR, DIAC and TRIAC for AC/DC power control

topics.title: SCR: symbol ,construction, working, characteristics
Working of SCR using two transistor analogy
Gate Triggering method of SCR
Natural Commutation techniques of SCR
Characteristics of DIAC and ,TRIAC
Optocoupler TRIAC driver : MOC 3041 and MOC 3083
TRIAC applications as fan regulator and ON-OFF control of AC power
SCR application for DC power control

unitOutcomes.description: Explain construction and working of operational amplifier
Describe IC 741 as Op-Amp
Explain parameter of op-Amp
Explain application of op-Amp with circuit and waveforms
Explain working and application of timer IC555

topics.title: Brief introduction to integrated circuits
Block diagram of typical operational amplifier
Op-Amp: Open loop, Close loop
Op-Amp parameters: Input Offset voltages, input offset current, input bias current, CMRR, slew rate, frequency response
Op-amp applications such as Voltage follower, Inverting amplifier, non-inverting amplifier, summing amplifier, integrator, differentiator, comparator, D-A converter, Wein bridge oscillator
IC 555: block diagram, working , Pin diagram
Application of IC 555: Mono stable Multivibrator, Bistable Multivibrator, Astable Multivibrator

unitOutcomes.description: Explain working of Regulated Power Supply
Explain working of different types of Fixed and variable voltage regulator IC
Describe SMPS applications
Explain working of solar battery charger circuits

topics.title: Regulated power supply
Three Terminal Fixed and Adjustable voltage regulator IC: 78xx, 79xx, LM317
Switch mode power supply(SMPS)
Solar based battery charger circuits

studentActivities: Prepare a table and interpret the technical specification of various transistors and thyristors using data sheets
Compare specifications of various voltage regulator ICs
Prepare a survey report of different heat sinks used in electronic devices/instruments and list out the alternatives used for heat sinks
Undertake a market survey of Different types of Amplifiers and oscillators modules
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics
'L' in section No. 4means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities
Guide students to find different ICs used in real time application based on diodes ,transistors and thyristors

microProjects.title: Transistor Amplifier
microProjects.description: a common emitter amplifier using transistor and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Op-Amp
microProjects.description: Build any application of op-Amp(IC-741) and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Oscillator
microProjects.description: Build any basic oscillator circuit and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Power control
microProjects.description: Build any application of AC powr control using TRIAC

microProjects.title: Power control
microProjects.description: Build any application of DC powr control using SCR

microProjects.title: Timer IC 555
microProjects.description: Build any circuit using timer IC 555 and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Battery Chargers
microProjects.description: Build a mobile/USB battery charger using solar cell

microProjects.title: Voltage regulator
microProjects.description: Build variable voltage regulator using LM317

books.title: Basic Electronics and Linear Circuits
books.author: N.N. Bhargava, D.C. Kulshreshtha, S.C. Gupta

books.title: Electronic Devices and Circuit: An Introduction
books.author: Mottershead, Allen

books.title: Fundamentals of Electronic Devices and Circuits
books.author: Bell, David

books.title: Op Amps and linear integrated circuit
books.author: Gayakwad

programOutcomes.description: Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment
